definitions.definition: an act or event that does not follow the laws of nature and is believed to be caused by God

examples.text: the miracle of rising from the grave

definitions.definition: a lucky thing that happens that you did not expect or think was possible

examples.text: It's a miracle (that) nobody was killed in the crash.
It would take a miracle to make this business profitable.
It would take a miracle to get the old car going again.
The letter's survival is something of a minor miracle.
There is still no miracle cure for this condition.

definitions.definition: a very good example or product of something

examples.text: The car is a miracle of engineering.
A colony of bees is a miracle of organization.
Her exercise programme has worked miracles for her.
You can work miracles with very little money if you follow our home decoration tips.
He performed miracles to get everything ready in time.
Don't expect this medicine to work miracles.
You shouldn't expect the treatment to work miracles.

wordOrigin: Middle English: via Old French from Latin miraculum ‘object of wonder’, from mirari ‘to wonder’, from mirus ‘wonderful’.
